metadata.synopsis: COM dialog with the prisoners in Cazador's Palace. Astarion meets Sebastian - a young man he seduced and brought to Cazador - for the first time in 170 years. Astarion was sure Sebastian was dead, but Cazador secretly turned him into a vampire spawn. If you aggrevate Sebastian, he'll be so full of hate and pain that he'll curse you.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Origin Debug Book (Ctrl+Shift+7)Astarion - Recruit - As CompanionAstarion - Act 3 Origin Moments - Cells

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Approaching the cells, you're met by hollow-eyed faces. There's an almost physical stink of decay and neglect.*
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: shot of the prisoners in the cells

27.speaker: Player
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner at the back of the cell, in the shadows

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: Oh they're disgusting. Cazador never fed on wretches like this.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner at the back of the cell, in the shadows

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: How did they get here? What is Cazador doing with them? I should have guessed there was more to it than Raphael would ever have told.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner at the back of the cell, in the shadows

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: How did they get here? What is Cazador doing with them? My brethren spoke nothing of this...
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner at the back of the cell, in the shadows

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: They could be sacrifices for the Black Mass, but where did he get them all?
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner at the back of the cell, in the shadows

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: But who knows? Maybe the old man's tastes've changed since I left.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner at the back of the cell, in the shadows

38.speaker: Sebastian
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner at the back of the cell, in the shadows

89.text: You're the one from the tavern. You smiled and joked and got me drunk.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion frowns and approaches the cell to get a better look at the prisoner who spoke in the previous node. The prisoner steps out of the shadow - he's emaciated, filthy, and dressed in rags that were once finery

106.speaker: Sebastian
106.text: You're the one from the tavern. You smiled and joked and got me drunk.
106.context: NodeContext: sad but not too emotional - this character is traumatised - addressing Astarion from inside a cell (Astarion is standing outside the cell looking in)

82.speaker: Astarion
82.context: NodeContext: looking at a victim of his he thought was long dead

93.speaker: Sebastian
93.text: You called me so many sweet things. My name sounded like a lyric on your tongue.
93.context: NodeContext: sad but not too emotional - this character is traumatised - addressing Astarion from inside a cell (Astarion is standing outside the cell looking in)

19.speaker: Astarion
19.context: NodeContext: says his name in shock, quietly

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: You were handsome. Shy. You'd never been kissed.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: steps closer to the barsNodeContext: in shock

2.speaker: Sebastian
2.text: You taught me how. And then you destroyed me.

30.speaker: Sebastian
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Prisoner launches himself forward, smashing against the bars, reaching for Astarion, who steps back just in time. The prisoner collapses sobbing.NodeContext: Shout of rage

62.speaker: Player
62.text: *Beneath the dirt and blood, you notice that every prisoner has a rune carved into their flesh.*
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up of main prisoner's face, and the rune-scar on his cheek

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: *Beneath the dirt and blood, you notice that every prisoner has a rune carved into their flesh.*
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up of main prisoner's face, and the rune-scar on his cheek

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *Beneath the dirt and blood, you notice that every prisoner has a rune carved into their flesh.*
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up of main prisoner's face, and the rune-scar on his cheek

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Look at the symbols - they all have scars.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: So Cazador marked them too - bound us all to his ritual.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: Gods, I know so many of these faces.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: His scar matches one of the runes on your back.

68.speaker: Astarion
68.text: Then they're bound to the Black Mass too. Bound through the scars. And through me.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: I know these faces - every one that shares my scar.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: It's not just him - I know so many of these faces.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: They're my conquests. I pursued them, seduced them, then brought them to Cazador. He told us he was feeding on them.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: But he turned them to spawn. He turned every last one so he'd have souls for this cursed ritual.

9.text: How long have I been down here?
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Getting from his knees to his feetNodeContext: rising anger

14.speaker: Sebastian
14.text: How long have I been down here?
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Getting from his knees to his feetNodeContext: rising anger

59.speaker: Player
59.context: NodeContext: muted, with a touch of shame

100.speaker: Astarion
100.text: One hundred and seventy years. You were one of my first.
100.context: NodeContext: muted, with a touch of shame

71.speaker: Sebastian
71.text: My family - my friends - they're gone...
71.context: NodeContext: cracked voice, his mind is slipping

26.speaker: Sebastian
26.text: You took them from me. You took everything from me!

48.speaker: Player
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

95.speaker: Sebastian
95.text: Free? We'll never be free while that monster lives.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

11.speaker: Sebastian
11.text: Free? We'll never be free while that monster lives.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: That's why we're here - to destroy Cazador.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

37.speaker: Sebastian
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

6.speaker: Player
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

81.speaker: Sebastian
81.text: And then? What happens to us?

55.speaker: Player
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

23.speaker: Sebastian
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

61.speaker: Sebastian
61.text: But even if you can kill him - what then? What happens to us?
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Like I said - we'll set you free.
103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

40.speaker: Player
40.text: We'll set you free - what else?
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

15.speaker: Sebastian
15.text: Free from this nightmare? It doesn't feel possible...

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: I promise you, I know that feeling all too well. But it can be done.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: That depends on you. Can you control your hunger?
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

97.speaker: Sebastian
97.text: I - I don't know. It's all I've ever felt...

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Trust me when I say I know the feeling. But you can resist the urge.

75.speaker: Sebastian
75.text: Whatever you do, just do it quickly. I can't go on waiting...

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: We'll be back. You have my word.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: What do you want to happen?
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

85.speaker: Sebastian
85.text: I don't know. I just don't want to die down here. Please...

76.speaker: Player
76.text: On second thought, freeing a bunch of ravenous spawn seems like a bad idea.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

51.speaker: Sebastian
51.text: No - no, you can't leave us here. Not now - not like this!
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

17.speaker: Sebastian
17.text: This nightmare never ends and it's your fault. You did this, damn you!
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at AstarionNodeContext: Accusing Astarion, a mix of rage of despair

72.speaker: Sebastian
72.text: I damn you to the Hells! I damn you to misery! I damn you - damn you...
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Breaking down, crying, falling to his kneesNodeContext: Mix of rage and sobbing tears - Sebastian is broken

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I have no intention of freeing a bunch of ravenous spawn.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Where's the key to your cell?

84.speaker: Sebastian
84.text: But he never sets it down - you'll never get it.

35.speaker: Sebastian
35.text: You can't stop him. No one can stop him.

101.text: Free? I'll never be free. I can't even die!

104.speaker: Sebastian
104.text: Free? I'll never be free. I can't even die!

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Stop whining - the only thing that matters is killing Cazador. He's responsible for all of this.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: pointing at Astarion and snarling in anger

5.speaker: Sebastian
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: pointing at Astarion and snarling in anger

63.text: I don't blame that monster. I blame him.
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: pointing at Astarion and snarling in anger

111.speaker: Sebastian
111.text: I don't blame that monster. I blame him.
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: pointing at Astarion and snarling in anger

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Cazador plans to use you in his ritual - that's why he scarred you. Let us help.

91.speaker: Sebastian
91.text: Help? Help? There's no helping us while that monster lives.

88.speaker: Sebastian
88.text: Help? Help? There's no helping us while that monster lives.

50.text: Help? From the one who cursed us to this?!

42.speaker: Sebastian
42.text: Help? From the one who cursed us to this?!

4.speaker: Sebastian
4.text: There's no escape. No escape for us and no escape for you, Astarion!

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Is this how all of your lovers end up?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Whatever this is, we don't have time for it.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: You don't understand - it's not just him.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: I know so many of these faces.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Is this how you used to live, Astarion?

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: Hardly. Cazador didn't keep me in luxury, but I've never seen anything like this.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: I have no idea what these wretches are doing here. 'The Master' had a more refined palate than this.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Astarion - do you know who these prisoners are?

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: I don't even know what this prison is. He hid all of this from me and the others.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: If I had to guess, I'd say they're part of his ritual. But where in the hells did they come from?

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: I'm just surprised to see such wretched-looking specimens - Cazador had a more refined palate than this.
